intro: Marginaria someyae, commonly known as the Socotra starfish flower, is a unique flowering plant native to the Socotra Archipelago. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers with five petals. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, adapting to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
